chargeHist.descr: Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (5th or 6th)
Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) and OWI (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) and the other charge, OWI (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Keith A Goodlad was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (5th or 6th)

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS Eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs. Sentence credit of 171 days were granted.
Concurrent with: Case 14CF0259

superMiscConds.notes: Restitution from case 14CF0259 to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision.
Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for City of Waukesha Police Dept. Costs to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.
Domestic Violence counseling and follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. Mental Health / Psychological evaluation and treatment deemed appropriat per agent.

No contact with the victim listed in the criminal complaint. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. Maintain employment and/or school combination. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

supervisions.notes: Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Keith A Goodlad in court, in custody, with Attorney Katie Beth Bricco.   Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for sentence hearing.  Attorney Bricco makes statements/comments regarding PSI.  State makes sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Bricco makes statements regarding sentencing.  Victim makes statements.  Defendant's brother makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #3:  IMPOSED SENTENCE:   

4 YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT -171 days)      **Concurrent with Case #14CF259**
  -  2 YEARS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  2 YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION;

*D/L REVOCATION: 36 months.
*IGNITION INTERLOCK: 36 months.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENED SUPERVISION:  
*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
*Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
*No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia 
*No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
*Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
*Domestic Violence Counseling and follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
*No contact with Victim listed in criminal complaint
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done
*Mental Heath / Psychological Evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate per agent.

BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $35.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation - to be forward to City of Waukesha Police Department);

COSTS:  $268.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision);

RESTITUTION:   $38.00 (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision)


Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
AMENDED, filed today.
Transcript received and filed for the following date and event: 06/17/14 motion hearing.
Filed
Sentencing hearing on August 13, 2014 at 11:00 am.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Keith A Goodlad in court, in custody, with Attorney Katie B Bricco.   Mary C Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court denies motion for reconsideration filed by Attorney Bricco.    Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing. Bound over. Information filed.  Reading is waived.  Defendant enters a no contest plea to Count #3 on amended information.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #3.  Counts #1, 4, 5, 6 and 7 are dismissed and read-in.  Count #2 is dismissed by operation of law.  Court orders presentence investigation.  Bail remains as fixed.
(Orig.) ... for reconsideration. Filed by Atty Bricco.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 26, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Keith A Goodlad in court, in custody, with Attorney Katie B Bricco.   Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for motion hearing.  Attorney Bricco makes statements regarding her position on motion.  State makes statements/responses to Attorney Bricco's motion request and requests that motion be denied.  Attorney Bricco makes additional statements.  Court denies motion.  Attorney Bricco requests plea and sentence date.  Court continued tolling time limits for preliminary hearing.  Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 26, 2014 at 10:00 am.
